column5: PARIS French drugmaker Sanofi withdrew its U.S. application for diabetes treatment lixisenatide on Thursday  delaying the drug's launch in the world's biggest pharmaceutical market.

column4: UPDATE 3-Sanofi  Zealand hit by U.S. setback for diabetes drug
column5: * Shares in Sanofi fall 2 pct  Zealand Pharma 16 pct   (Adds context  analyst comments  updates shares)

column4: China drugmaker Sino Biopharmaceutical investigating TV corruption report
column5: SHANGHAI Chinese drug company Sino Biopharmaceutical Ltd has set up a team to investigate allegations broadcast on state television that its majority-owned subsidiary had paid for illegal overseas trips for doctors  it said on Thursday.

column4: UPDATE 1-China drugmaker Sino Biopharmaceutical investigating TV corruption report
column5: SHANGHAI  Sept 12 Chinese drug company Sino Biopharmaceutical Ltd has set up a team to investigate allegations broadcast on state television that its majority-owned subsidiary had paid for illegal overseas trips for doctors  it said on Thursday.

column4: Sanofi says to pull U.S. diabetes drug application
column5: PARIS  Sept 12 French drugmaker Sanofi  said on Thursday it would withdraw its U.S. application for diabetes treatment lixisenatide in order to wait for results from an ongoing cardiovascular patient test.

column4: China drugmaker Sino Biopharmaceutical investigating TV corruption report
column5: SHANGHAI  Sept 12 Chinese drug company Sino Biopharmaceutical Ltd has set up a team to investigate allegations broadcast on state television that its majority-owned subsidiary had paid for illegal overseas trips for doctors  it said on Thursday.

column4: Schlumberger targets equipment reliability on par with autos
column5: Sept 12 Schlumberger Ltd plans to make better use of its equipment and ensure a performance quality in line with that of the automotive industry  which would mean a dramatic improvement for the world's largest oilfield services company.

column4: UPDATE 3-Statoil reveals chronic weak security at Algerian plant before deadly attack
column5: * Says security generally not well understood by Statoil leadership

column4: Statoil CEO should consider stepping down  union says
column5: OSLO Statoil  Chief Executive Helge Lund should consider resigning after the company's investigation uncovered serious management shortcomings prior to an attack on its gas plant in Algeria  Hilde-Marit Rysst  the head of energy union SAFE said on Thursday.

column4: UPDATE 1- Hudson's Bay sales up; to cut dividend after Saks deal closes
column5: TORONTO  Sept 12 Retailer Hudson's Bay Co  reported higher quarterly sales and a small adjusted profit on Thursday as robust demand for apparel at its Canadian namesake stores offset lower traffic at its Lord & Taylor chain in the United States.

column4: European shares buoyed by telecom takeover talks
column5: LONDON  Sept 12 European shares edged towards five-year highs on Thursday  buoyed by merger news in the telecom sector and more broadly supported by diplomatic initiatives over Syria.

column4: Blackstone hopes Hilton would be worth $30 billion: source
column5: Blackstone Group LP is hoping the stock market will value Hilton Worldwide Inc at around $30 billion  including debt  a source familiar with the situation said  as the private equity firm filed papers on Thursday to take the U.S. hotel operator public.

column4: UPDATE 4-Blackstone hopes Hilton would be worth $30 bln -source
column5: * Hilton brands include Conrad  Waldorf Astoria  Doubletree

column4: UPDATE 1-U.S. central bankers criticize SEC's money-market proposals
column5: Sept 12 Heads of the 12 U.S. Federal Reserve regional banks on Thursday strongly criticized a component of a U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission proposal aimed at preventing runs on money-market funds  saying it does little to change current rules.

column4: U.S. Bancorp lowers long-term growth forecast-WSJ
column5: Sept 12 U.S. Bancorp reduced its long-term revenue and income growth forecast  citing a slump in mortgage activity as interest rates rise  the Wall Street Journal reported.

column4: Valero delays northern California crude-rail project
column5: HOUSTON  Sept 12 Valero Energy Corp has delayed for more than a year a plan to build an offloading facility to receive crude via rail at its northern California refinery to allow time for an environmental assessment to be done  Chief Executive Bill Klesse told analysts on Thursday.

column4: GLOBAL MARKETS-Equities dip  dollar slips; Fed focus curbs moves
column5: * Stocks dip as investors await Fed meeting next week     * Weak euro zone factory data pressures euro     * After Verizon deal  Treasuries regain footing     * Dollar falls to two-week low       By Ellen Freilich     NEW YORK  Sept 12 U.S. stocks slipped  safe-haven Treasuries prices rose and the dollar dipped on Thursday as investors turned defensive before  next week's Federal Reserve policy meeting. column5: LONDON  Sept 12 German Bunds pushed higher on Thursday as investors bought back into a cheapened market after a slew of debt sales from higher-rated sovereign issuers.

column5: * Victims of Tazreen fire in November also under discussion

column4: Washington mayor vetoes wage bill aimed at big retailers
column5: WASHINGTON Washington Mayor Vincent Gray on Thursday vetoed a bill that would have forced big retailers to pay a premium over the local minimum wage  calling it "a job killer" for a city trying to lure Wal-Mart and other big-box stores.

column4: UPDATE 3-Washington mayor vetoes wage bill aimed at big retailers
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 12 Washington Mayor Vincent Gray on Thursday vetoed a bill that would have forced big retailers to pay a premium over the local minimum wage  calling it "a job killer" for a city trying to lure Wal-Mart and other big-box stores.

column5: (Replaces "For example" with "Other companies" in last paragraph)

column4: REUTERS SUMMIT-Thrifty spending habits seen dying hard even as economy lifts
column5: LONDON/NEW YORK  Sept 12 Consumers are sticking to frugal shopping habits developed in the recession even as developed economies show signs of recovery  suggesting some behaviour changes could be permanent  industry executives say.

column4: Disney to buy up to $8 billion in shares in fiscal '14: CFO
column5: LOS ANGELES Media giant Walt Disney Co  will increase its share buybacks to $6 billion to $8 billion in fiscal 2014  Chief Financial Officer Jay Rasulo told investors on Thursday  sending shares up 3 percent.

column5: Weyerhaeuser Company
